He hunched down and crept around the corner, where he took a peek of the lobby. Guards could be seen just outside the window. His suspicions confirmed, the thief turned back to Terra.

"There are soldiers out front." Locke explained the situation to her quietly. "We should leave from the back exit."

"Okay, lead the way..!" Terra whispered.

Locke and Terra snuck towards the back exit of the inn, there were no windows to see through from this exit though, so they had no way of knowing if there would be any soldiers around. Terra was nervous by this, but Locke chose to push his luck, and...
13322221211212212121211111.title: Locke will carry the tiny woman this time

133222212112122121212111111.content:
Locke tried to assess the situation. The back exit was their only option, but he still wanted to take the chance and escape Vector as soon as possible. He opened the door and scanned the surroundings. The back door led to an empty quiet back alley.

"I don't see any guards here. The coast is clear Terra."

Celes could barely hear them from the inside of Locke's pocket. She tried to say something, but it became obvious that her tiny voice couldn't reach them without her screaming loudly. She instead chose to remain silent and trust her two friends, even though she wished she could be more useful to them. Then again, being so close to Locke felt like a bonus. Perhaps it was the pocket itself, but she felt a warm sensation in her current situation.

As Terra and Locke spoke about what do to next, they decided to barricade the exit with some trash cans and garbage, just to be safe. When they were done, the half-human half-esper looked at her thief friend.

"We need to leave right now Locke. The longer we wait the greater risk we take of getting caught again!" Terra said with a low voice. Locke seemed to agree.

"Right. Let's try to leave this city while we still have a chance then." he said and looked down at his pocket. "Hang tight Celes, we're gonna make a short run!"

Locke and Terra started to run as fast as they could. Celes tried to prepare herself the best she could, grabbing on to the fabric of Locke's pocket. But being so tiny was still a disadvantage, even in a big comfortable pocket. As long as Locke was walking there wasn't any problem, but as soon as he started to run, Celes discovered the disadvantages. She was thrown around from one side to the other, which also made her quite dizzy. She screamed from all the bouncing and cursed her situation, wishing for her mana to return to her as soon as possible.

There was still a lot of people out in the streets, which made it easier for the two rebels to blend in with the crowd. They kept a low profile the whole time and eventually managed to sneak out of the city. As soon as they were a safe distance from Vector, Terra and Locke took a breather. They hugged each other closely, happy it was all over. Then Terra remembered Celes.

"Um... Locke, you better check that Celes is still in your pocket..." she said, remembering everything about the "cleavage incident".

"Oh yeah, you're right!" Locke said and looked down on his pocket again. "Celes? Are you still down there?"

Celes was all too dizzy from the shaky travel to be able to respond. When she didn't respond it made Locke nervous. He stuck his hand in his pocket to make sure that his friend had not fallen out.

Celes was still recovering from all the shaking and was trying to stand up when she suddenly saw a big hand coming at her. She was totally unprepared for it. She felt an enormous finger touch the front of her body. The force from it was so strong that it dragged her green leotard down to her feet, fully exposing her body.

Locke thought he heard something that resembled a scream. There was also something stuck on his finger. Curious about what it was, he removed his hand from the pocket to check it out. What he then saw was stuck on his finger made him blush immensely.
133222212112122121212111111.title: Escaping Vector

choices: The leotard had fallen off his finger as he hurriedly tried to give it back
Celes had her uniform back but it was covered in sweat, she couldn't put it on!
1332222121121221212121111112.content:
Locke recognized the tiny green cloth, as Celes' leotard. Even in it's shrunken state, it was easily recognizable as the one she always wore, and the result of many wandering male gazes the ex-general attracted, even from Locke. The thief looked at the tiny uniform and contemplated keeping it to himself for a moment. He could just say that it fell off his finger when he brought it out of his pocket, that would be believable, right?

Locke sighed, mentally scolding himself for thinking about doing such a thing to his friend, one so tiny and helpless no less! He could hear little squeaks coming from his pocket, Celes trying to tell him to give back her uniform, no doubt.

As much as Locke would have liked to keep the tiny blonde's only piece of clothing as a reminder of this situation, it just didn't feel right to the young man. He couldn't leave the poor shrunken woman to run around naked. Although he might have very well liked to see it...

No! He thought. It belongs to Celes, I should give it back!

"What is it, Locke?" Terra asked. She walked ahead of him to see what he was looking at so intently. "What is that?"

Locke's face reddened even deeper, and the thief hurriedly tried to stuff the tiny leotard back into his pocket for Celes.

"N-Nothing!" He stammered, as he jammed his hand back into the pocket with Celes in it. "I-I, uh, I just thought I had something sticky on my hand... That's all."

"Sticky?" Terra whispered. She remembered the sticky situation that she had inadvertently put Celes into earlier, and shuddered.

"Anyway, we should be going." Locke said, becoming more serious now. "Celes is all right, so it should be fine."

"Okay!" Terra nodded.

Locke and Terra then continued their trek. Locke thinking that everything was fine now that Celes had her clothes back, but little did he know...
1332222121121221212121111112.title: Locke and the leotard

choices: Celes have had it. Try to escape this big embarrasing prison.
Celes endures. Stay in the pocket and remain calm.
13322221211212212121211111121.content:
At first Celes was in chock. She couldn't believe what just had happened. It had all gone so fast - one second fully dressed, the next in the nude. As she discovered that she was now without clothes, Celes panicked and let out a loud scream. She looked around, desperately trying to find something to cover herself with, but besides herself, Locke's pocket was all empty.

She was smart enough to realize that it had all been a terrible accident, but it was still extremely embarrassing for her, as being tiny wasn't enough. Even though she wore something so closely resembling a swimsuit she didn't like the show off her feminine sides. Being totally naked was no exception.

She covered herself in shame and felt anger rise within her. She stood up on her feet and looked up towards the opening of the pocket.

"Give me back my clothes you big klutz!" Celes shouted while blushing like a tomato. When she received no answer, she raised her voice and tried again, but nothing happened. At first it seemed like the poor girl would stay naked for quite some time. To Celes' surprise that wasn't the case. Suddenly she saw the pocket opening up. At the top she could see Locke's finger slowly lowering down her leotard towards her. Just as she thought she would get it back, a gust of wind grabbed on to it, blew off Locke's finger and disappeared.

"Oh for crying out loud!!" Celes yelled.
13322221211212212121211111121.title: Tiny AND naked...

choices: They set up camp for the night
They push on and go to the meeting place
133222212112122121212111111212.content:
Celes was upset, irate even, Locke's careless handling of her leotard had cost her the piece of clothing she had left and had left her naked in his pocket. Being tiny was tough enough, but adding involuntary nudity to the mix just made things that much worse for the poor woman. She considered her chances of survival if she just up and jumped out of Locke's pocket now. But for all the troubles of staying in Locke's pocket, she had to admit that it was better than what had happened when she was with Terra, just thinking about it still made the tiny woman twitch. It was that and the high chance that jumping out now would leave her not only stranded, but still tiny and completely nude. Celes sighed. The embarrassment would kill her, but she'd have to endure.

Please don't let anyone else see me like this! Celes thought. ... And don't let anything else bad happen... She prayed.

Meanwhile, above Celes' current residence, Locke's pocket, Terra and the thief were still running farther and farther from the city. Locke was thinking about how Celes was holding up down there, he'd have to make it up to her later for sure, thinking that he'd only accidentally removed her clothes, and not lost them as well.
As the two ran along, Terra was beginning to get a little winded from all the running. She was slowing down, and Locke noticed.

"Let's take a break." He said. "We're almost there anyway. Or at least, we should be."

Terra nodded in agreement. She stopped running and took a moment to catch her breath.

"H-Hey, Locke..." Terra started. "Just where are we going anyway?"

"Oh, I haven't told you yet, have I? Sorry about that." Locke said. "We're headed for the Blackjack."

"Really!?" Terra asked excitedly.

"Yeah, I managed to send a message to Setzer and the rest in town." Locke explained. "I told them to wait for us outside town."

"Oh, thank goodness!" Terra exclaimed. "So they're just around here, right?"

"Not exactly." Locke shook his head. "Be it shouldn't be too far now, but then again..."

"What is it?" Terra asked.

Locke was taking a moment to look around, he noticed how dark it was getting, and how tired Terra seemed to be. He also thought about how Celes was doing, wondering if taking a rest would be enough to get her magic back up, at least enough for her to restore herself. The meet up point was still a few miles out, so their airship would not attract the attention of the empire. He wondered if it might just be better to set up a camp around here, he was sure the rest of the group would understand and wait for them until tomorrow. He'd ask Terra first before making a decision though.

"I've got to be honest with you Terra, the meeting place is actually still a few miles away." Locke told her. "And after all the fight and running we did today, it might be best to take a long break, you know, set up camp somewhere around here. I doubt the soldiers will look for us here, so it should safe."

"Hmm... Maybe you're right..." Terra said. "I'm not really tired though, and it's only a few miles, right?" Terra paused, she took a moment to consider how Celes was doing. "But I am worried about Celes, maybe we should set up camp for tonight..."

Next...
133222212112122121212111111212.title: Celes endures embarassment in a pocket

choices: Leave Celes alone by the stream!
Make Locke play with her a little!
1332222121121221212121111112121.content:
"I think she's just fine! She was... resting, last time I checked!" Locke said nervously, fully aware that Celes probably could hear every word. He was still somewhat embarrassed about the incident with her clothes. He tried to change the subject. "Anyway, you're right. We should set up a camp. It's getting dark and we're not close enough to finish the walk today."

Terra noticed that Locke was acting strange, but she decided to let it pass for the time being. She just nodded in response.
"Fine, what do you want me to do?"

Locke started to look around. They lacked most of the necessary camping equipment, such as beds or tents. He also needed an excuse to get away and check on Celes. He needed guidelines from the tiny girl what to do next. Having her in his pocket was enough to make his heart race.

"Try to make make a campfire with your magic." Locke said. "I'll go and see if I can find some water. And don't worry, Celes is safe with me!"

"Okay. Be careful Locke!" Terra said in response.

It didn't take long before Locke found a small stream. The water was fresh and tasted incredible. He filled his water bottle and then turned to a more serious matter at hand.

"Ok Celes, I'm going to pick you up now..." the thief said as he slowly put his hand down into his pocket, hoping she wasn't mad about the earlier incident. He carefully grabbed on to little creature and removed her from her involuntary confinement, unaware of her current state. Celes' skin was extremely soft. Just the touch itself was enough to make Locke all red. Even though he grabbed Celes by the waist, he accidentally touched other parts of her as well, due to his large fingers. It was almost as she was struggling, but it was hard to tell.

In fact, Celes was panicking. She tried to yell all she could about not being ready, but all in vain. There was nothing she could do now to prevent Locke from seeing her in her birthday suit.

Locke opened his hand, turning the grip into a platform for tiny Celes. There she was, in the palm of his hand, covering the most intimate parts of her body. So timid and beautiful in her cursed state. Yet, furious for something so small. And... naked? Locke's eyes turned wide by the sight.

"C-Celes...? You... you're n... I mean... your leotard?"

"Locke, you clumsy dolt!!" Celes yelled, catching the giant by surprise. She tried to cover her the best she could.

"Eh... uh... I..." Locke stammered in response. His face was turning all red too.

"Pervert! Womanizer! First you rip off my clothes and then you fail to return them to me! This treatment is unacceptable. I'm a general for crying out loud!"

Locke smiled a little. This was Celes' way of dealing with her situation, trying to be authoritarian. She had acted the same way in the Opera House when she was forced to sing and wear a dress. "I'm a general, not some opera floozy!" was her exact words back then.

"Celes I... I'm so sorry. It wasn't on purpose! I thought I returned it to you?"

"No you didn't. My leotard blew away with the wind before I had the chance of putting it back on. You realize I can't grow back now, right?" Celes continued. "Even if I had the magic I couldn't, because everyone would see me! You better take responsibility for this Locke!"

Celes was blushing immensely. She was still embarrassed about the whole situation. On the other hand it was a relief to be out of Locke's stuffy pocket. The air was so fresh and clean compared to Vector's smoggy environment. They both became silent. Locke didn't know what to say. After all, he liked Celes a lot. After a short while, she broke the silence.

"I need something to cover myself with... can you give me a handkerchief or something?"

Locke did not have anything like it. He quickly scouted his surroundings and noticed a plant next to him. He ripped off two leaves from it and handed it to the small general.

"Here, perhaps you can wear these? T-tie it around you or something?"

Celes hesitated. She would probably look more like a fairy rather than a general with those on her.

"I guess they'll do for now. Turn your head away and don't peak!" she said as started to dress herself in her new flower clothes. The color green really suited Celes and made her even more cute in her current state. Locke was chocked.

"Celes... you look amazing..." he mumbled, taking Celes by surprise.

"You... y-you think? A...anyway, I'm kind of dirty from being thrown around in your filthy pocket. Put me down on the ground. I want to have some privacy and take a dip in the stream."
1332222121121221212121111112121.title: Camping time!

13322221211212212121211111121211.content:
"Yeah, of course." Locke said.

Locke carried Celes over to the stream and placed his hand down by the rocks. He watched as the tiny woman stepped off his hand onto the hard surface below, entranced by how cute she looked doing the simple task. Celes went and tested the water by dipping a tiny foot into it. When she was ready to get in, she turned back to Locke to ask for some privacy.

"Thank you, Locke." She said in a loud voice for the giant to hear her. "I've got it from here. Now, if you'll please allow me some privacy, I'd like to take a bath."

Locke nodded slowly, his face still quite red. "I'll leave you to it, then..." He said.

And with that, Locke turned and left Celes by herself. Once she was sure he was gone, Celes removed her makeshift clothing and stepped into the stream. The water was quite shallow by any normal person's standards, but to the inch tall Celes, it was like a deep lake, perfect for swimming and bathing in.

Celes enjoyed some alone time in the stream. Even though the dangers of being alone at this size were still in the back of her mind, Celes didn't really feel worried about anything bad happening to her, the water felt fantastic on her skin, it was easy for her to forget the dangers, and also use it to wash away the grime and dirt that she had accumulated while in Locke's pocket. She had herself feeling clean and refreshed within a few minutes.

After she was feeling satisfactorily refreshed, Celes decided to spend the rest of her time in the stream swimming around. Being cramped up in little spaces all day made her restless and uncomfortable, although she tried not to show it to her friends, so being able to move and stretch her body felt great!

Several minutes had passed as she swam around freely. Celes was starting to feel tired though, and swam back to the rocky bank to take a break. She found it somewhat hard to walk across the rough stones, they were nearly as big as she was after all! So she was glad that she had left her leafy clothing close by.

Celes paused. "What was that?" She thought she heard something.

A second later her suspicions were confirmed, she could it hear it clearly this time, there was someone, or something, moving nearby, and it sounded like they were coming to where she was! She couldn't see who it was over the tall grass and shrubbery, and with her leaves were still a few comparative meters away, she made the quick decision to hide herself back in the water. She made a mad dash back into the stream to hide from whatever it was coming her way. Slipping back into the stream, still in the nude, Celes watched as a person appeared before her.

It was...
13322221211212212121211111121211.title: Celes' swim

choices: ...dives and start to swim away quietly.
133222212112122121212111111212112.content:
The tall giant stopped just next to the stream at the exact same spot Celes were at. The tiny little blonde was about to gasp when she saw who it was. She managed to cover her mouth with both of her hands before making any sounds. The tall figure above her was none other than Leo Christophe - a young General of the Gestahlian Empire and a former colleague to Celes.

General Leo was the only person in the whole Empire that Celes actually respected. She even found him somewhat handsome from time to time. Sadly, he was still a part of the enemy, the same enemy that Celes now was fighting on a daily basis. Lucky for her she was only an inch tall and somewhat hidden in the water. Fighting was of course not even an option. For the moment she just continued to observe him. What was he doing out here in the middle of nowhere? Was he tracking them?

"You two!" General Leo said, addressing two soldiers accompanying him, while filling his water bottle and almost dragging poor Celes into it. "I think we've lost the trail. Find us a good spot and set up a camp. We're staying here tonight!"

I need to get back to the camp. Celes thought. Leo is one if the finest swordsmen alive. Locke and Terra wouldn't stand a chance. On the other hand, I'm so small that I might be able to spy on them for a while and get some critical intel. Then again, it might be dangerous. Oh crud, what should I do?

Celes...
133222212112122121212111111212112.title: An old flame

choices: Leo is kind to his prisoner
Leo is cruel to his prisoner
1332222121121221212121111112121121.content:
"ACHOO!" Celes suddenly sneezed!

"Hmm..?" Leo murmured, clearly hearing the sound and now looking down for the source.

Oh no! I didn't even feel it coming! Celes thought. She looked up at the giant general, only to see his huge face looking down at her. There goes any chance I had of spying on them!

Thinking herself found out, Celes thought fast and began swimming away from the giant as fast as she could. Above her, Leo was simply just trying to figure out if he actually heard anything, or if it was just in his head. He didn't see anything below him, at first, until a tiny figure about an inch big started to move, it looked to be swimming in the river.

"What in the world..?" Leo said softly as he watched the tiny being move about.

Leo looked closer and could hardly believe his eyes at the sight, it was Celes, a former fellow Gesthalian general and unfortunate enemy of his. Only now, she was only about an inch tall! He could make out her tiny curves and long, blond hair even from his viewpoint. His face reddened slightly when he realized she was without clothes. It took him a moment to decide how to proceed.

The tiny woman was swimming away as fast as she could, but she wasn't getting very far. Indeed, Leo simply reached out his hand and grabbed the escaping tiny.

Celes squirmed and struggled in Leo's grasp, shouting at him to let her go. When she was brought up face-to-face with Leo, she gasped and blushed, despite herself. Although for his part, Leo allowed her some modesty, covering her body from the neck down in a gentle grip. The two stared at each other for a while, until Leo broke the silence.

"Celes... it really is you..." He said.

Celes was a little scared facing the giant foe, she wasn't sure if he was going to be cruel, or more gentle with her. She couldn't tell from his monotone reaction just now what he was thinking. All she knew of the man gave her some hope that he would treat her right, and she hoped that she was right...
1332222121121221212121111112121121.title: Big general, Small ex-general

choices: "I'll let you go and leave you here!"
13322221211212212121211111121211211.content:
Neither of the two generals knew what to say at first. Leo was simply baffled of the little thing he had found in the water, and Celes was just too embarrassed to speak. Leo noted this and tried to take a kind approach towards her.

"My dear Celes... how is this even possible?" Leo said confused, but still intrigued, while staring at her. "You're so small, out here in the middle of nowhere!"

"W-well I..." Celes mumbled as she tried to find the right words to explain the situation. She was however interrupted when the giant suddenly decided to ease the grip around her and turn his closed hand into an open palm. Leo did not want to risk hurting her.

"A-aah!!"

Celes gasped as she tumbled down and landed on her butt against the "fleshy floor" that was Leo's palm. She quickly covered herself the best she could, but Leo had already managed too see a good portion of her intimate treasures. She was indeed a very beautiful girl, almost looking like a fairy in her current form. Celes herself did not particularly enjoy it and curved herself to a ball in order to cover her parts the best way possible. Being naked was obviously something she had to get used to.

"Haha, my sincere apologies Celes." Leo said with a laugh as he gently patted her on the head with his forefinger. "It was not my intent to make you uncomfortable, but I didn't want to risk hurting you. Now please tell me..."

Celes blushed. She didn't like being treated like a kid, but Leo had always been her senior. This time it felt different.

"It's... a long story, really..."

"Last I heard you where in jail." Leo continued, not willing to drop the topic so easily. "People told me you had betrayed the Empire, but I couldn't believe it. The Emperor refused to let me see you. So please tell me, I got time. I won't show you to my soldiers."

Celes hesitated, but decided it was best to tell Leo the truth. She knew that he had his own set of rules and standards, and would judge her accordingly based on them. She told him about how her view on the Empire's goals had changed, how she had used her magic to shrink herself, and how she had managed to escape together with Locke and Terra, leaving the embarrassing parts out of the story. Leo listened carefully while keeping an eye on his soldiers further away. When Celes finished he just nodded in silence, contemplating his next decision.

"So you've sided with the Rebels now?" Leo asked.

"Y-Yes, I'm afraid so." Celes responded, not daring to look Leo in the eyes. "Or at least Locke and Terra."

"You've had a rough ride Celes. I can't say I envy you. You haven't even betrayed us in that sense, other than abandoning the Empire's cause."

"G...general Leo..."
13322221211212212121211111121211211.title: A small interrogation

choices: Celes makes it back to camp
Celes gets lost on the way
133222212112122121212111111212112111.content:
"I'll let you go and leave you here!" Leo stated, sort of triumphantly. Celes was shocked to hear him say that, she thought she'd be taken as a tiny prisoner for sure. The general's kindness almost left her speechless.

"General, I... thank you..!" Celes said.

"Please, don't mention it." Leo said. Celes smiled, knowing that he truly meant it. "We may be enemies now, but I cannot take you prisoner with good mind. I can tell you now that I'd only treat you with the same respect I'd treat any other prisoner of war, but once we got back to the capital..." Leo shivered before continuing, "I can only imagine the kind of things they'd do to you at your size, and the very thought makes me cringe."

Celes knew he was right, she trusted him enough to treat her well, even at her size. But she couldn't say the same for the empire as a whole, the thought of being toyed with and experimented on by the likes of Kefka was far too terrible for her to contemplate. Indeed, she was glad it had been Leo who found her, instead of one of his soldiers.

"Besides, you're not much of a threat to us like this." Leo said with a small laugh, and giving Celes a reassuring smirk.

"Thank you, General Leo..." Celes smiled and bowed her head slightly.

Leo smiled back at her and then looked around, making sure the soldiers weren't near. He then bent down and placed Celes back on the ground and told her to run, again assuring her that he would not chase her. Celes thanked the general and ran off. Leo watched as the tiny, shrunken woman scurried off, both looking forward to and dreading the time when they'd meet again, under more normal circumstances.

Meanwhile, Celes was running as fast as her tiny legs could carry her. She didn't want to stop for anything, lest Leo change his mind, although she did trust the man. She knew she had to warn Terra and Locke about him and his soldiers scouting the area. So she ran, not caring or even remembering about her current state of undress, she just had to warn the others as soon as she could!
133222212112122121212111111212112111.title: Leo gives her a pass

choices: Celes is caught in the spell and shrinks together with Terra.
1332222121121221212121111112121121111.content:
Despite her size, Celes ran as fast as her legs could carry her, through the tall grass that grew around her like a forest. Her heart was pounding fast, both from the sprint and the unexpected meeting with General Leo. Even though it had been embarrassing, Celes was glad she have had the opportunity to meet him again. Sure, she was in her birthday suit, but at the same time free and alive. Eventually her magic would return to her and make her normal again. Perhaps things wasn't so bad after all.

The long run back to the camp took more time than expected and made Celes once again realize just how tiny she really was. Being naked was a disadvantage and she was forced to run with one arm pushed against her fleshy treasures in order to keep her balance. When she finally arrived close to camp, she had been running for 20 minutes straight. Sweaty and tired, the young general sat down on a small rock to catch her breath. It was not long until she heard voices, but something was amiss. There was at least more than two of them.

"Haha, can you believe it? Of all the places we manage to find two rebel scum it's out here!"

Celes decided to carefully approach the area and was surprised to find her friends tied up on the ground. Next to Locke stood two guards and a couple of yards away was Terra, pleading to the guards to stop harassing her thief friend. This had to be General Leo's men, acting without their commander's knowledge. Celes panicked. There was no way Leo would be able to help Locke and Terra liked he had helped her.

This isn't good! Celes thought. I need to help them somehow... but... oh well here goes...

The tiny blonde decided to act quickly while she still had the opportunity. When everyone seemed focused on Locke she ran up to Terra, in between her legs and - without her knowledge - into her skirt. Celes was not very fond of returning to this familiar place, especially not in the nude, but at least she had a plan. She sat down to catch her breath, next to Terra's huge wall of panty cloth.

It's not the best hiding spot, but I cannot afford to lose them if they start to move. she thought. Once my magical powers return to me I'll shrink Terra, and then perhaps she can shrink Locke as well...

Meanwhile, Terra was looking helplessly at Locke. The two guards was preparing to leave the area with their prisoners and she realized she had to do something before it would be too late. She remembered the shrinking spell Celes had taught her and thought that if there was a moment to use it, now would be the time. While the guards were occupied with Locke, she closed her eyes and started to concentrate, silently whispering some of the proper sentences. The spell did not go unnoticed, at least not by a very tiny creature.

"Huh? Wha...what's going on?" Celes asked herself as magical energy started to swirl around her body, as well as Terra's thighs.
1332222121121221212121111112121121111.title: Camp capture

choices: Terra encounters some soldiers looking for her
13322221211212212121211111121211211112.content:
"Oh.. Oh, no!" Celes cried as she realized what the magical energy around her was. Terra was shrinking herself again!

Terra was happy her spell was working as she noticed everything around her start to stretch out and get bigger before her eyes. It didn't take long before she was back down to an inch tall. She smiled to herself, thinking that Celes would be proud. Though at the moment, Celes was anything but.

While Terra was now only an inch tall, Celes had become an inch tall to Terra, making the tinier blond not much more than a millimeter in height! The idea of being so small frightened the twice-shrunken woman, and she felt more vulnerable and helpless then ever. To make matters worse, Terra hadn't seemed to notice her presence yet. Thankfully, she was still lodged in the larger girl's skirt, being in there was humiliating for the former general, but she did feel safe. If only she could get Terra's attention, then it make things a little better for her.

Meanwhile, the freshly shrunken Terra got up and ran as fast as she could away from the soldiers, ducking into cover behind the various camping supplies that were now much bigger than her inch-tall self. She stayed in hiding until she was sure that she hadn't been seen, then ran behind the large tent she had set up and out of the immediate campsite. Finding some rather tall grass that she thought she could hide in, Terra made a dash into her green cover.

Leo... She thought. The name sounded familiar to her. Could he have been the kind general that she had met before? Though the letters appeared to be written by a young child Leo could slowly but surely interpret the letters.

"C... e... les... is... here. Celes is here. Wait... Celes!?"

Celes had to struggle not to be blown away by the sheer force of Leo's voice when he spoke her name. His breath felt like a small hurricane. As soon as the winds calmed down she got on her feet again and quickly realized that she had been blown away a couple of inches from her special spot.

Oh no! I need to hurry back. This is the only chance I'll get! Celes thought as she started to run back while her chest bounced heavily. She could see how Leo was searching the area, and when she saw his eyes suddenly lock on to her area, the almost microscopic Celes started jumping up and down, waving her arms as much as she could.

"Leo!! I'm down here!! Please notice me!" Celes yelled loudly.

Leo himself was both chocked and surprised by the message. He leaned slowly towards the area where the message said Celes would be located on. First he didn't notice anything in particular, but just a few moments later he could make out a tiny speck an inch away from the pointer's head. Since he couldn't really see what it was, he reached for a nearby looking glass and focused it upon the area. When Leo saw that it really was Celes, jumping frenetically while involuntarily showcasing her beautiful body, he couldn't believe her eyes. Celes had really become even tinier than before.

"I can't believe it! It's really you Celes. Your friend wasn't lying!" Leo said. He could see the tiny girl starting to cover herself, but to hear what she was saying was impossible. He started to analyze the situation and what to do next.
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.title: Leo discovers Celes

1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.content:
Celes was relieved to have finally been spotted by her former comrade. Being seen at her current size and state of undress made her feel embarrassed to be seen, being covered in mostly ink only added to that feeling. Still, she knew she had to get Leo's attention not only for her own sake, but for Terra's sake as well. Now with Leo looking down at her through a looking glass, she had achieved that goal, at the cost of her modesty. But she still able to relax a little and even tried to explain the situation to Leo.

"Leo! You have to get Terra! Please!" Celes shouted as loud as she could. Leo looked like a giant to her, far bigger than Terra or even Locke had ever been. Celes wondered just how little she appeared to him, and if her voice could possibly carry to his ears.

"I'm sorry, Celes. But I can't hear what you're saying." Leo said to the tiny woman.

Even though the older man had spoken softly, the force of his voice was still enough to cause some discomfort to the tiny, tiny Celes, who covered her ears in response. Leo apologized quickly and quietly, this time not hurting poor Celes with his voice.

Celes recovered swiftly and held her hand up towards Leo's imposing face to signify she was okay. Still, she was disappointed to hear Leo's response. If the comparative giant couldn't hear her she wondered how she was going to convince him to release Terra from whatever confinement they had put her in.

"But..." Leo started to say. Celes looked up at him hopefully. "I assume you'd like to help your little friend, yes?"

Celes smiled and nodded up at Leo.

"Very well." Leo whispered to the shrunken blonde. "It's for the best that you two are reunited. After all, communications between you and I are all but impossible. You'd probably be much more comfortable with her around."

"Yes! Please release her!" Celes shouted, well aware that Leo could not hear her.

"I see you like the idea. Well then..." Leo sat up from his chair. He placed the looking glass down next to the speck of Celes. "Wait here so I can find you when I return. I'll go and get this Terra now."

With that, Leo walked out of the tent, leaving tiny little Celes alone. The tiny blond was glad that Leo was going to let Terra go. Celes clasped her hands together by her chest and sighed.

"Thank you, Leo." Celes said.

Time passed as Celes paced around the area Leo had told her to wait by. The gigantic looking glass was like a building to her, it was intimidating a little, but Celes stayed by it in order for Leo to find her when he came back. As she paced, the ink on her body started to fall off, only small splotches of the writing material still remained. But still Celes waited for Leo's return, the longer she waited the more she worried. Being stuck so small on Leo's desk was starting to get to her.

Oh, Leo, where are you? I hope nothing bad has happened to him, or Terra... Celes thought. She watched the flap of the tent expectantly.
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.title: Leo goes to get Terra

choices: Heading back to Leo's tent to get Celes
Helping Locke escape from his cell
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.content:
Leo had gone to get Terra so she and Celes could be free from his wrongful imprisonment of her and her friends. However, this meant he had to go back to the "prison" tent the soldiers had set up hastily earlier to keep Locke in a cell. On his way through the tent, Locke called out to the general, calling him out for being another one of Gasthal's lackeys. An argument ensued and Leo found himself having to explain himself to his prisoner.

"You don't understand the situation." Leo said dismissively.

"What's not to understand? Some washed up old general got lucky finding me outside of town and now you're going to reap the rewards, hmm? Maybe even get promoted! Wouldn't that be nice? Though, you did miss one thing..."

"And what would that be?" Leo asked, growing annoyed with Locke's attitude.

"You only got me. The others are still on the loose. And they're not going to let this go so easily!" The caged young man smirked. Though in his position of having his arms cuffed behind his back, it didn't have quite the intimidating effect he was going for.

"... Very well." Leo said sternly, having to remind himself that he was here to help Locke, however inadvertently, so he and Celes and Terra could go free. Though he could just as well tell Locke the situation, he decided it was better to keep it to himself, just so he could get to Terra sooner. "If you'll excuse me..."

Locke scoffed and slid onto his back, looking like he was going to catch some sleep for the night. Leo, however, just ignored him and walked on to the place Terra was being kept.

After he had caught her earlier, he had kept her in a small cage meant for a bird, but a good fit for the shrunken girl. He then put her in a drawer in one of the desks of the makeshift prison tent. He did so to keep her out of the eyes of his rowdy soldiers, and was now very glad he did, as he wouldn't dare trust any of them with handling the miniscule young woman at her current size.

But, when Leo opened the drawer Terra's cage was in, he gasped in shock. The cage was empty! The surprised general hurriedly looked around the room, it was mostly empty with little hiding spaces, but despite this his tiny prisoner was nowhere to be found!

"Oh no, I hope she hasn't tried to escape." Leo said to himself, worried about the tiny girl's safety. If she did escape and was trying to run, then he'd need to find her before his men did!

Cursing under his breath, Leo ran out of the room in search of the tiny Terra, being extra careful to watch his step and be discreet about looking for her, lest his men think something suspicious was afoot.

Meanwhile, Terra had indeed escaped her little jail cell, and was currently...
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.title: Where is Terra?

1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.content:
The first mistake General Leo made as he had started to look for Terra was to only check the ground for something moving close to his feet. Escape was exactly what Terra had done. In fact, the green-haired girl had used her magical powers to transform herself into an esper, not only granting her more magic and an all pink body, but the ability to fly and the strength to open the drawer in which she had been trapped in.

"I'm sorry General, but I really need to find my little Celes!" Terra thought to herself as she hovered high up in the air with a pounding heart, close to the tent's ceiling. She had eavesdropped his and Locke's conversation, but for the moment she had decided that it was for the best to not involve Leo based on previous experiences.

Her clothes had magically disappeared as she had transformed into her pink esper-form, leaving her in an elegant naked state and a curvy body. She was still tiny however, and that would be a disadvantage in any sort of confrontation with the Empire's soldiers.

"I hate to do this and endanger Locke, but there's no choice. I got no time to waste, and I need to find Celes before it is too late! She could be blown of the table, or found by some insect!" Terra thought to herself as she tried adapt to flying while not feeling ashamed about her new form. In fact, she was still new to it and had only experienced it a handful of times. She had even been called a monster be some. Had anyone seen her in her current tiny form though, Terra had more likely been called a pixie rather than a monster. Still, she had no wish of being discovered. She flew silently through the air over to Locke.

"Locke! It's me, Terra! Don't worry, we'll get you out of this. I just need to go find Terra!"

Locke could barely believe his eyes at first, and started to blush heavily as he saw the tiny little esper-human in front of him, hovering not far away from his nose. Terra seemed so elegant, delicate and fragile. He nodded towards her.

"Just promise me you will be careful. Don't let the guards see you, please!" Locke whispered.

Terra nodded in response, turning her back against the young thief to then fly off on her mission to retrieve her tiny friend. She didn't exactly know the way to General Leo's tent, but Celes couldn't have left that place even if she wanted to.

"I'll help you escape once I'm back with Celes. And I'll talk to Leo again if I have too!"

Using her nimble form, Terra flew out from tent to tent, trying to navigate her way through the camp, immediately beginning her search. With no memory of the area, she went from tent to tent, when suddenly...
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.title: An itty bitty esper on the loose

choices: The guard puts her in a jar for safekeeping
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.content:
"Not this one!" Terra murmured to herself as she flew in and out of various tents set up in the army's makeshift campsite.

Even though she was flying and running on plenty of spare magic, Terra's size might it take her quite a while to get around the camp, especially in the dark. That same dark of night that was cast over the camp would normally have given her a great cover to be stealthy in, but thanks to the bright pink glow of her Esper-form, Terra was sure to catch the eyes of a guard if she didn't move carefully, looking to any on-lookers like a pink firefly.

"Not this one either!" Terra was starting to get frustrated with her lack of success. The camp wasn't that big, but Terra's luck was just not on her side right now. So the shrunken girl was forced to go through each tent until she found the one that belonged to the General Leo.

Terra doubled down her efforts and quickly flew back through the tent's curtains to go back outside and look for another tent to check, but in her haste she flew right into something huge!

"Ow!" Terra squeaked as she recoiled in the air, rubbing her head as she had smacked it right into whatever it was she flew into.

"Now what have we here?" A loud voice asked.

Terra collected herself, floating in mid-air, and looked up to see that it was a guard that she'd just run into. A huge, giant guard that was at least fifty times bigger than her!

"Eep!" Terra cried out and tried to fly away, but before she could the big guard's hand caught her mid-flight. Suddenly, she was thrust upwards by the swift motion of the huge hand. In the next moment, the mini girl was face-to-face with a bewildered guard.

"No way... I thought you was just a weird little bug, but, you're a tiny little..." The guard hesitated, seemingly needing time to gather his thoughts. "... Little wingless fairy!" The guard surmised after a moment.

Terra twitched at the comment. It was bad enough to get caught again, but to now be subject to examination by the uncouth guard was a bit humiliating. For the moment though, Terra stayed in his hand, wondering whether or not she should struggle or fight back against the comparative giant.

"Hey! What you got over there?" The call of another guard came from afar. Terra looked and saw that a couple more guards were coming over the her captor, no doubt curious about the pink glow of the "Wingless Fairy" he'd found. Terra shook her head, she knew now that she couldn't simply let this go on any further, she had to get out of here now!

Terra concentrated her magic power together to form a spell strong enough to let her escape, and...
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.title: Esper hunting

choices: Terra tries to lose the soldiers
Terra was wrong, her Esper powers run out now!
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.content:
Terra was desperate to escape this foolish soldier's clutches as she knew she didn't have much time to last in her Esper form. So, without even thinking about how powerful she should go with her next move, Terra recited a spell she thought would be able to help her out.

"Firaga!' Terra cast her spell. She aimed her hands like arm cannons and blasted powerful(albeit minute) fireballs at the soldier, hitting him in his forehead dead-on.

"Yeow!" The soldier yelled and reflexively grabbed at his head. His flinch inadvertently made his other hand holding Terra loose, giving the shrunken half-Esper ample time to escape.

"Whew!" Terra sighed, and the miniaturized girl quickly jetted out of the soldier's hand and flew towards another tent to find Celes.

Free again, Terra flew straight for the closest tent. However, her little interaction with the soldiers had made them take notice of the tiny purple-glowing figure flying about the campsite, and the soldiers that had seen one of their own get blasted by sudden small fire spells were able to follow her even at her one inch size, thanks in part to the small glowing trail she left behind herself as she flew.

"Get that thing!" One of the soldiers shouted. The others followed his lead and chased after the tiny Terra, thinking now that it was some kind of wild beast capable of casting magic somehow, not one of them thinking it could possibly be the infamous Terra Branford, reduced to the size of a bug by her own magic and using her 'true' Esper form to fly around.

"Oh, darn it!" Terra groaned. She looked behind herself and saw that many giant-looking soldiers were now hot on her trail.

If they keep following me, I'll end up leading them right to poor Celes! Terra thought.

Though she knew Celes was probably way too small for the soldiers to see, she didn't want to risk her micro-sized friend's safety. On the other hand, she could tell she only had a few more minutes of Esper-power left in her, so leading the soldiers away from Celes could end up in her having to find her friend in her normal, shrunken state.

Terra thought about it for a moment...
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.title: Not so successful escape

choices: The guards become disoriented by the magic.
The magic fails and Terra gets captured.
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.content:
No, I have to find Celes while I’m still in Esper form! Terra thought to herself while flying as fast as she could in order to escape the soldiers behind her. There’s no way I would be able to climb a whole table as a human!

Despite flying as fast as she could, Terra noticed that her pursuers where catching up to her, making her heart beat faster than ever before. She could still feel the remnants from the guard’s big warm hand on her naked pink body, which made her tingle in an embarrassing way.

I have to do this! Celes is counting on me! I might not have the speed, but I’m nimble, and I still have some magic! I just need a diversion so I can enter that tent without them noticing.

As Terra tried to form a plan in the middle of her flight, she suddenly caught attention of something in the far corner of her right eye. It was lucky she did, because moments later, a giant hand came towards her in high speed, something she barely managed to dodge. Then another one hand, almost managing grab her too, this time even touching parts of her body. She let out a scream, scared of ending up being captured again. Her slippery movements had probably saved her life.

I need to do something now… but what? Maybe if… WAIT! I know!

Terra instantly changed direction. Instead of flying towards the tent, she turned right up into the air, aiming straight for the heads of the soldiers, knowing exactly what she would do next.

My magic is not as strong in in this size, and there’s a risk it might fail, or turn me back to a human, but I have no other choice!

“We got you now, little pixie!” one of the guards said as they reached for her. Just as they were about to catch her, the tiny pink-skinned girl cast her magic.

“Confuse!” Terra yelled, hitting all the guards right in their faces with her bright, disorienting magic. The following second, she froze mid-air, praying for the magic to have an effect on the giant Gestahlian soldiers.
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.title: Confusing the soldiers

1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.content:
Terra waited with bated breath for the soldiers to react to her little spell. She was anxious and a bit self-conscious from her body's current state, minied and nude, pink and busted. The shrunken girl gulped as the seconds began to feel like minutes. Then, finally, the bright magic dissipated to reveal the whole set of soldiers simply standing there, looking quite unawares all of a sudden.

"Wait. What were we doing?" One of the soldiers asked, his voice droning on like he had just woken up.

"I don't remember..." Another replied, looking forward at nothing in particular but seeming transfixed on the empty space anyway. In fact, all of the soldiers had stopped and adjusted themselves to staring with eyes glazed over and mouths agape just looking at various spots in the scenery. They stumbled around aimlessly, not a single one of them taking any notice of the tiny, glowing pink speck that was Terra flying in her mini esper form.

Yes! Perfect! Terra cheered inside her head. She smiled at her handiwork, then flew off towards the tent she last recalled seeing Celes in. She knew her magic power was failing fast, and that last spell didn't help matters. Time was even more of the essence at this point, but Terra kept her wits about her and focused on saving her teenier friend.

Hold on, Celes, I'm coming! Terra thought. She reached her highest flight speed and thrust herself into the tent. She sighed in relief upon entering it and seeing that it was indeed the good general's tent and not some random low-level soldier's bunk.

Remembering where she last saw the tinier Celes, Terra made a bee-line towards General Leo's desk. Floating just inches above the wooden surface, Terra scoured the area for any signs of the millimeter-tall blond. She spotted a paper with some scribbles that seemed to read "Celes is here" on it, although it was hard to tell for certain because of how spotty the penmanship was. Terra was smart enough to put two and two together and deduce that this was how Celes had contacted General Leo before, which surely meant that Celes was still stranded in this spot somewhere...
1332222121121221212121111112121121111211.title: Terra's dazzling escape

choices: Stop before it got out of hand!
13322221211212212122.content:
Terra closely watched Celes as the tiny one cleaned herself and dried her hair with the big towel. Celes only wore her green swimsuit now, and the cold water had made certain parts of her body even more revealing. For a 18-year old, she had a great body. She was nothing close to resembling a mighty general now, just a cute tiny girl in a beautiful swimsuit. Terra just couldn't stop looking at her, and it was more than just curiosity.

Even though she tried to shake it out of her head, Terra couldn't forget about what she just had experienced together with Celes. Her cheeks were still red from all the tingling excitement, and the more she thought about what had passed the faster her heart was racing.

It felt so strange. The warm sensation between her legs was still there. Without doubt, she felt some sort of attraction to her blonde friend. She already adored her for several reasons, but this feeling was something new and completely different. Was this love? Lust? Terra wouldn't know. She had been controlled by the Empire her whole life and never gotten to experience things like other girls did in her age. Not even getting to know her own body. At least until now.

"Terra? Why are you looking at me like that?" Celes asked.

"Eh?" I-I..." the giant girl mumbled, returning to the real world efter being lost in deep thoughts. Her heart was still racing and she was desperate to cherish the energy she felt. She wanted to pick up Celes and play with her, but hesitated. What if Celes got angry? Then again, Celes was not a powerful general anymore. More like a helpless little girl without magical powers. A little poke wouldn't hurt her, right? She made the decision and suddenly reached for Celes and grabbed her gently.

"T-terra? What are you doing?" Celes asked with a nervous voice. "I'm not a doll. Put me down!"

Terra obeyed, but only to a slight degree. She put Celes in the middle of her right hands palm and went out to one of the beds.

"Well, to be frank you're even smaller than a doll..." Terra giggled and smiled. "Don't be scared Celes, I only want to look at you!"

Celes was about to protest, but not quickly enough. With newborn confidence, Terra moved her left hand close to Celes and carefully touched her with the tip of her finger. With a gentle touch she ran it over Celes' left breast, continued down to her navel, and then up again towards her right breast. Her chest was big, even for a tiny creature like her. Celes gasped and her eyes widened from the touch. She even got goose bumps. No one, boy or girl, had ever touched her like that.

Terra did not stop there. She wanted to deal with the sexual tension that had arisen. She continued to fondle Celes with her pinkie, thoroughly examining her every spot.

"I... I can't deny it Celes. Your presence down there... I really felt it. Never felt anything like it in my life. I-I don't know, but it was kind of nice."

Celes did not answer. She was breathing heavily and her body seemed to have responded to the treatment. One could even think she was starting to enjoy it.

Terra decided to...
13322221211212212122.title: A tiny advantage

1332222222.content: Jumping back to the PS2-era. Final Fantasy 12?
1332222222.title: Final Fantasy 12?

choices: Ashe shrinks out of her clothes
133222222211.content:
The Lady Ashe was practicing her skills with the sword in the middle of the night. Her companions had fallen asleep, leaving Ashe alone. Since she still had the energy to practice, she decided it wise to brush up on her skills.

As Ashe practiced in the desert, a monster approached.

"The perfect opportunity to test my skills..." Ashe said to herself.

Ashe ran towards the monster. As she approached the monster, it began to cast a spell. Before Ashe could strike the creature, the monster unleashed its spell.

Ashe suddenly felt sick. She suddenly felt as if she was losing her mind as it appeared as if the world was growing.
133222222211.title: A little bit of Ashe

1332222222111.content: Ashe was shocked to discover that her clothes did not shrink with her. The tiny, naked woman could only estimate that she was around 3 inches tall. Her options at this point were limited merely to attempting to escape.
1332222222111.title: Ashe alone

choices: Ashe returns to her friends for help
13322222221111.content:
Ashe dashed away as quickly as her shrunken body could move. The monster quickly lost interest in the shrunken girl and resumed its path. Ashe eventually glanced behind her to see the giant monster wandering away.

"Somehow, I've escaped..." Ashe said to herself.

The princess of Dalmasca had escaped but was still extremely vulnerable. She was shrunk and naked and her magical abilities were likewise reduced in power.

Ashe attempted to use a spell to cure her current affliction but found that none of her spells restored her from her diminutive height.
13322222221111.title: Escaping Ashe

133222222212.content: Focus on Penelo or Fran?
133222222212.title: Penelo or Fran?

13322222222.content: How about a girl from the Secret of Mana/Seiken Densetsu-series?
13322222222.title: Secret of Mana

133222222221.content: Shrink the beautiful warrior amazon Riesz?
133222222221.title: Riesz

1332222222212.content: Perhaps you want to shrink the purple-haired magician Angela?
1332222222212.title: Angela

choices: ... on the floor of her room.
13322222222121.content:
The streets laid silent as three warriors of Mana emerged from a dark alley, currently on their way back to the tavern at which they were staying. The port town of Beiser was normally bustling with activity, but since it was way past midnight, most citizens were now sleeping soundly in their homes.

There was a good reason why Angela, Riesz, and Duran was awake at this late hour. They had just paid a visit to The Black Market, a shady establishment that was open only during night time. It was a place of secrecy, where people would sell all sorts of items and services: from delicate elixirs and deadly weapons, to private shows with exotic dancers — even magical objects. The latter had been especially important for the trio, as they were on the hunt for a particular object that could aid them in their quest.

“I can’t believe how cheap it was! Now we can finally go meet that Sage Domperi figure!” Angela said as she triumphantly swung the newly bought object, the Minor Mallet, back and forth.

The Minor Mallet, or the Chibikko Hammer as some called it, was a magic item with the ability to shrink anyone hit by it. By using this object on themselves, the warriors of Mana could become tiny enough to meet the Koropokkur people and their leader, Sage Domperi.

How this Sage could be a master strategist was something Angela failed to understand. How could someone tiny as a mouse advice armies? Finding the Koropokkur would also be tricky. No one in the party had ever seen one, and rumour was that they were less than 3 inches tall, no bigger than a teaspoon. As for their village, all they knew was that it was located somewhere in the Rabite Forest, south of Jadd, but finding it would be a problem for a later time. For now, the trio had at least managed to secure the mallet.

“Be careful with that thing, Angela,” Duran said to the mage as he dodged one of her reckless swings. “You sure it’s a good idea that you hold on to it?” he asked, not feeling confident in her companion’s way of handling such an important object.

“Why of course Duran dear," Angela responded. "Not only am I the leader here, which makes me the de facto holder of this item, I’m also a princess and the most beautiful member of our party. I have all the right to wield it!"

To finish things off, Angela teased her companions by wiggling her butt a bit, something she normally did against her enemies, flirting with them to confuse them. Thanks to her risque red leotard that revealed a big portion of her soft round cheeks, it was usually pretty effective. "Did I say I'm charming as well?”

“I’m a princess too you know…” Riesz grumbled, not impressed by Angela's act. The young amazon from the Kingdom of Laurent had reason to be sceptical. After all, the whole reason for seeking out Sage Domperi was so they could seek his advice on how to get Laurent back from its occupants, the sand-nation of Nevarl. For now, Riesz and Duran just looked at each other and shrugged, deciding it was best to let Angela be Angela. The purple-haired Altenan could come off as selfish at times, but she had proven she had a good heart.

“She certainly doesn’t lack confidence, that’s for sure!” Duran replied with a chuckle. In the end, he was happy to be in the company of these two girls. Angela had become a quick and talented learner of magic, and Riesz skill with a spear was just as good as Duran’s own swordsmanship. The brown-haired knight was also sure that his companions' stunning looks had played a part in the obtainment of the Minor Mallet.

Shortly after his remark, the party arrived at the tavern inn. As the trio parted ways to go to their separate rooms, Angela went towards her room located on the second floor in the far corner, which was just next to Riesz’s. Tomorrow, the would meet up with the other's and set off for Jadd.

“Well, this sure was easier than exp…” Angela’s words were cut short. As she opened the door, her foot suddenly hit the door threshold, causing her to lose her balance and fall forward, gasping by the sudden turn of events.

It all happened too quickly. As she fell, she lost her grip on the mallet, and as she landed roughly the floor, Angela felt a strong hit on her backhead, followed by a magical sensation that was felt through her entire body. Moments later, she passed out.

Many hours later, Angela woke up…
13322222222121.title: Using one's head

choices: and began shrinking rapidly while still in the water
and managed to get out of the hot spring before she started shrinking
1341.content:
Mai was enjoying her training exercesis alone in the mountains. With a nice and very private hot spring nearby, Mai felt like she was in heaven every time she took a dip.

One evening after some rather intense training, Mai walked over to her favorite hot spring. Quickly undressing, Mai stretched out a little before slowly lowering herself into the water.

"This is heaven." Mai let out as she felt the water envelop her body.

What Mai didn't know was that she was being watched by a woman versed in the ways of magic. Watching as Mai bathed, the woman grew jealous of Mai's figure.

'This woman comes to the mountains where I reside and uses my hot spring and looks like that?!' The woman thought to herself as she watched Mai bathing.

'I will show her what it means to disturb my grounds. And in the process, I'll have a better figure than her as well.' The woman thought and immediately began casting her spell.

Mai started to feel a little funny while she was still in the water...
1341.title: Mai shrink

choices: Mai has to fend for herself in a big world
13411.content:
Before Mai knew it, the world began to grow all around her. "What's going on?!" Mai shouted as she shrank.

It wasn't long until Mai finally stopped shrinking at the height of four inches tall. She was forced to swim out of the hot spring.

"What happened?" Mai asked herself after she climbed out of the spring.
13411.title: Shrinking in the spring

choices: Mai is attacked by an animal
134112.content:
The woman that shrank Mai laughed at the sight of the miniature woman. She quickly disappeared, confident that the miniature woman was soon going to go the way of the dodo.

Mai stared at the large world around her. Her clothes wouldn't fit her and she didn't see much of a point in ripping them up when she was in a rather secluded spot. But she wondered why she had shrunk.

"No use waiting around here." Mai told herself.
134112.title: Mai time alone

choices: An old lady that was watching her
1341122.content:
Mai thought just exploring the area was the best way to go. So the shrunken naked woman had begun her journey.

Mai enjoyed walking through the tall grass and the giant flowers. The smell was great as Mai let her naked body be hit by the buds of the flower.

“This is the life. Nothing better than this,” Mai thought as she walks. Saw huge animals, large rivers and even a huge tree.

“I’ll try to climb that,” Mai thought as the naked woman jumps from branch to branch to get a better view of the area. She soon was at the top and had a great view.

13522221.content:
Lara sighed- these guards really thought they could win. It truly was pathetic. She waited until the idiots had to reload, and then she whipped out her Desert Eagles and took both of them out with a shot from each gun. She stepped forward, ready to enter the temple.

As she strode through the ruins, Lara noticed a lack of traps or guards...it was almost too easy. Lara hates it when it gets too easy. As she stepped forward, even her trained senses didn't notice the slight depression of one of the stones her foot had stepped on. Not even her trained hearing could discern the silent whirring of gears inside the temple walls. The one thing she could discern was that a huge trap door had opened in the floor a foot ahead of her.

"Is that really all they got," Lara groaned. This was the easiest temple she had ever broken into. At this moment there was a rumbling sound behind her and she turned in time to see a stone wall swing into place, blocking her path backward. At the same time, another wall swung forward until it was even with the other ledge.

"Well, that's more like it," Lara smirked, "Now I just have to-"

The wall behind her swung forward again, sending her tumbling into the pit. Lara fell for what felt like ages, unable to do anything but scream in terror. Finally, she splashed into a pool of water.

"Next time i'll bring C4..." Lara promised herself. She swam out to the mouth of the cave, finding herself back in the temple. A light shiver, almost a tingle, ran through her body. She started out in a brisk walk down the tunnel path. It was strange, however, that everything seemed heavier on her body. Brushing the thought aside, she continued walking. Then, right in front of the entrance to the room, it happened. The tingles came with a vengeance, and she fell out of her own boots. The tingles intensified, and she shot down, shrinking? Lara screamed once more as she literally shrank into her clothes.
